sections.name: Life Experiences & Development
sections.description: These questions explore your early formative experiences and how they shaped your fundamental sense of safety and understanding.

questions.text: When you think back to your early childhood, what moments stand out the most emotionally?
questions.placeholder: Describe the moments that feel most significant, whether happy, scary, confusing, or comforting...

questions.text: Can you describe a time when you felt very safe or very unsafe as a child?
questions.placeholder: What was happening? Who was there? How did your body feel?

questions.text: How did the adults around you respond when you needed comfort or help?
questions.placeholder: Think about parents, teachers, relatives... what patterns did you notice?

questions.text: What's a memory where you felt deeply understood or deeply misunderstood?
questions.placeholder: What was the situation? What made you feel seen or invisible?

sections.name: Social Life, Bullying & Peer Dynamics
sections.description: Explore your social development and how interactions with peers shaped your self-image and social patterns.

questions.text: How would you describe your social place growing up?
questions.placeholder: Were you popular, quiet, athletic, artistic, an outsider, a leader?

questions.text: Were there moments other kids treated you differentlyâ€”better or worse? What do you think influenced that?
Can you share a memory where someone embarrassed, mocked, or humiliated you? What stood out about you in that situation (height, looks, clothing, personality, interests, etc.)?
What's a memory where someone made you feel respected, admired, or valued?
If you experienced bullying or exclusion, what do you think people focused on or targeted?

sections.name: Stressful, Dangerous, or Transformative Moments
sections.description: Critical moments that changed your worldview, sense of safety, or forced you to grow up quickly.

questions.text: Can you describe an event that changed how you view people or trust?
What's an experience that shaped your sense of danger or safety?
Was there a moment when you had to act older or stronger than you were?
What stressful or frightening memories do you feel changed how you react today?

sections.name: Identity, Pride & Shame Memories
sections.description: Moments that defined your sense of self, worth, and identity formation.

questions.text: What's the first moment in your life that made you feel proud of yourself?
Can you recall a moment that made you think, 'This is who I am'?
What's an experience that made you feel not good enough or inadequate?
Has someone's words ever permanently changed how you see yourself?

sections.name: Core Personality Assessment
sections.description: Scientific personality assessment to map your fundamental traits and tendencies.

questions.text: How open are you to new experiences, ideas, and unconventional thinking?
How organized, disciplined, and reliable are you?
How much do you enjoy social interaction and gain energy from being around others?
How compassionate, cooperative, and trusting are you toward others?
How sensitive are you to stress and negative emotions?
